channel.title: Business roundtable
channel.description:
A program of current comment from leading members of America's business community.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: The rich and the poor nations
item.description: Guests on this program are Dr. A.N. Agarwala and Dr. Peter J. Lloyd.
item.dc:creator: Seelye, Alfred L.
item.dc:subject: United States--Economic conditions--1961-1971

item.title: Are profits the only responsibilities for a business?
item.description: Guests on this program are Louis F. Pope, Jr. and Raymon H. Mulford.
item.dc:creator: Seelye, Alfred L.
item.dc:subject: United States--Economic conditions--1961-1971

item.title: Is American business too big?
item.description: Guests on this program are Crawford H. Greenewalt and Donald F. Turner.
item.dc:creator: Seelye, Alfred L.
item.dc:subject: United States--Economic conditions--1961-1971

item.title: Congress and business in 1968
item.description: Guests for this program are Jack Wooldridge and Wilbur Martin, editors of Nation's Business magazine.

item.dc:subject: United States--Economic conditions--1961-1971

item.title: Program 15 of 26
item.description: This prog.: Civil Rights in 1968. Guest: Dr. John A. Hannah, president of Michigan State U. and chairman of the U.S. Commission on Civil Rights.

item.dc:subject: United States--Economic conditions--1961-1971

item.title: Program 21 of 26
item.description: This prog.: Business and Urban Problems. Guests: John R. Thomas, Jr., of General Motors, and M. John Pittoni of Volunteers in Service to America (VISTA).
